body_content.explanation: (in particular sports, especially football and ice hockey) in a position that is not allowed by the rules of the game, often in front of the ball:
examples: The official blew the whistle because the player was offside.
The referee gave a penalty to the tight end because he jumped offsides.

body_content.explanation: on or relating to the side of a vehicle that is furthest from the edge of the road and closest to the centre of the road when you are driving, i.e. (in the UK) on the right side:
examples: The offside rear wheel needs replacing.

body_content.explanation: in sports such as football, an occasion when a player is offside:
examples: Coventry had a goal disallowed for offside.

body_content.explanation: the side of a vehicle that is furthest from the edge of the road and closest to the centre of the road when you are driving, i.e. (in the UK) the right side:
examples: The car was scraped all along the offside.
